description.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers' capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for pro-poor sanitation and institutionalization of sanitation, (b) promote public private partnerships for sanitation and hygiene, (c) support equitable delivery of quality sanitation services and (d) strengthen monitoring and evaluation of sanitation and hygiene., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Disaster Risk Reduction, Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, pregnant women and children, particularly the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from benefit from equitable national policies, guidelines and tools for, and innovative monitoring and evaluation of, high impact and quality interventions for survival and development.

title.narrative: Increased evidence and policymakers? capacity to (a) formulate and revise policies, guidelines and tools for pro-poor sanitationand institutionalization of sanitation, (b) promote public private partnerships for sanitation and hygiene, (c) support equitabledelivery of quality sanitation services and (d) strengthen monitoring and evaluation of sanitation and hygiene.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s technical support contributed to three national sanitation standards, Assessment Guidelines on WASH in Healthcare Facilities, Child Environmental Health Indicators (CEHI), and Handwashing Guideline in Response to COVID-19 in School. Public-private partnerships were further promoted through engaging the private sector in national and regional knowledge exchange activities. With UNICEF’s support, advocacy materials titled Chinese People&39;s Toilet Hygiene and Cultural Literacy was released on World Toilet Day.;UNICEF promoted environmental health with the draft report on CEHI developed and advocacy events organized, including 2020 Environmental Health Week event and 2020-2021 Environmental Health Campaign. Moreover, the piloting of indoor air pollution intervention continues. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2021

title.narrative: Number of WASH policies/standards/strategies/guidelines for rural communities, education and health facilities, all leading to financing, improved and adopted(45326)

actual.value: 2020:Cumulatively 15 over the past five years. 8 new strategies, standards and guidelines issued in 2020.
